year_question.question: Which academic year did you start your association with E-Cell?

role_question.question: What role(s) have you played in E-Cell activities?

rating_questions.question: I was satisfied with the event crowd — the participants were thoughtful and engaged.
I felt that my presence contributed meaningfully to the overall experience.
The events upheld a sense of purpose and direction throughout.
There was genuine curiosity and commitment from the participants.
The event themes and structure aligned well with current entrepreneurial landscapes.
The organizational flow felt smooth and intentional.
There was adequate space for nuanced dialogue and mentoring.
I would like to engage with the E-Cell in future initiatives.
I felt the event was about real impact, not just presentation.
The students demonstrated remarkable ownership and professionalism.
I saw attempts to explore original ideas, not just copied templates.
The team managed unexpected situations with maturity.
It was easy to see the long-term potential in the event’s goals.
I felt proud to be part of this initiative.

open_ended.question: Can you share any experiences where you felt the engineering college setting affected what E-Cell could or couldn’t do?
What do you think this E-Cell can do next to raise its standard to national level?
Share one moment or conversation that stayed with you.
One constructive suggestion for the organizing team:

event_question.question: Which E-Cell event did you most recently participate in?

rating_questions.question: I was satisfied with the event crowd — it felt like a safe and inspiring environment.
I walked away with new perspectives I hadn’t considered before.
The sessions helped me understand entrepreneurship more deeply.
I felt a genuine connection to the ideas and people involved.
I learned something I couldn’t have picked up from just YouTube or classes.
The speakers or mentors made me rethink how I look at problems.
I was encouraged to reflect on my own goals and values.
The overall energy of the event made me want to build something.
The E-Cell team created a welcoming, open space for everyone.
I felt mentally and emotionally engaged throughout.
I didn’t feel lost or irrelevant during any session.
The event inspired me to take some kind of action (even if small).
I got to meet or listen to someone who truly inspired me.
I felt that this event was made for students and by students in the best way.
The event improved my understanding of business and made me want to grow/start a startup.

open_ended.question: What’s one thing that changed in your thinking because of this event?
What’s one moment that felt special or memorable?
What could we change to make this event feel more 'you'?
